info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 10:19PM CDT until June 14 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL COMANCHE...EAST CENTRAL JACKSON...SOUTH CENTRAL KIOWA AND NORTHWESTERN TILLMAN COUNTIES... At 1018 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Manitou, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...At 10 PM, a 69 mph wind gust was reported in Altus. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Frederick, Snyder, Tipton, Mountain Park, Manitou, Headrick, Hollister, and southwestern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing widespread wind damage across near Manitou. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
